intro: Galeopsis angustifolia var. parviflora, commonly known as narrowleaf horseweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is an annual herb with slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The flowers are small, pale blue to purple, and arranged in clusters, typical of the Scrophulariaceae family. It thrives in disturbed soils and can be found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. This plant is known for its adaptability and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
